info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 3:13PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Nueces, central San Patricio, northeastern Jim Wells, southwestern Refugio and southeastern Bee Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 313 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near St. Paul, or near Sinton, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corpus Christi, Robstown, Sinton, Taft, Corpus Christi International Airport, Odem, St. Paul, San Patricio, Edroy, Bluntzer, West Sinton, Clarkwood, Annaville, Calallen, Taft Southwest and Tuloso. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 6 and 30. US Highway 181 between mile markers 614 and 628. US Highway 77 between mile markers 636 and 658. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
